page.title: 20VILLAGE SURVEY PART 4
page.content: FROM OUR SURVEY WE FOUND THAT THE MAJORITY OF THE WORKERS IN WEST BUTTERWICK WORK IN SCUNTHORPE. THIS ACCOUNTS FOR 40% OF THE WORKING POPULATION. 23% WORK IN THE VILLAGE AND 11% IN THE NEIGHBOURING ISLE OF AXHOLME VILLAGES. 9% MOVE AROUND THE ISLE. THESE ARE MAINLY IN THE BUILDING TRADE. 7% WORK IN NEARBY TOWNS eg DONCASTER, GAINSBOROUGH, RETFORD, BRIGG, AND IMMINGHAM. OF THE REMAINDER 1.5% WORK ABROAD AND THE REST TRAVEL TO LONDON. A SURVEY ON HOUSING FOUND THAT 33% OF THE HOUSES WERE BUILT BETWEEN 1946 AND 1965. 25% WERE BUILT AFTER 1966. BETWEEN 1926 AND 1945 12.5% WERE BUILT. OF THE 264 HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE, WE HAD 144 REPLIES TO OUR QUESTIONNAIRE, OF WHICH 23 DID NOT KNOW WHEN THEIR HOUSE WAS BUILT. THE 3 OLDEST KNOWN HOUSES WERE BUILT BETWEEN 1766 AND 1785.
